name: treatment of used domestic refrigerator, controlled dismantling | used domestic refrigerator | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22081/documentation

The activity models the safe treatment of a large used domestic refrigeration machine by physical dismantling in a safe and controlled manner in a recycling facility. The process takes place in a formal recycling site in the capital of Ghana, Accra. This dataset includes electricity input necessary for the recovery of the refrigerant and infrastructure. The recovery efficiency is estimated at 70% of the refrigerant present in the refrigeration circuit. ;The dataset averages three types of refrigerations machines based on the refrigerant they contain. Calculations regarding the average fridge are found on the table attached. ;References for refrigerant: ;Sampson Atiemo, Lambert Faabeluon, Andreas Manhart, Letitia Nyaaba, Tobias Schleicher, 2016, Baseline Assessment on E-waste Management in Ghana, Sustainable Recycling Industries. Accra, June 2016. Retrieved online at http://www.sustainable-recycling.org/sampson_2016_sri-ghana/ on 31/01/2018.;Amoyaw-Osei, Y & Agyekum, O.O. & Pwamang, John & Thiébaud (-Müller, Esther & Fasko, R & Schluep, Mathias. (2011). Ghana e-waste country assessment. SBC e-waste Africa project. 

Activity starts with the reception of the used refrigeration machine by the formal recycler. Transportation is not include in this LCI.

Activity ends when the recycler removes all valuable metals. Activity includes emissions to air.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Controlled and safe dismantling of used domestic refrigeration machine without any temporal distinction.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Dismantling of refrigerator in a recycling facility. Technology involves anti-pollution measures such as removal of refrigerant and removal of insulation foam in a controlled manner.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Estimations or conclusions were drawn beyond the original observation points, as those were reported in literature. Assumptions and calculations performed are well documented.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collection took place using literature.

exchanges.description:
The amount represents emissions from uncontrolled venting of the refrigerant that is contained in the refrigeration circuit of an average machine. According to literature, there are 85 g of refrigerant R600a in the refrigerator machine. The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (3288 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units). It is assumed that the recovery efficiency is 70% according to IPCC.

Reference: Rüdenauer, I.; Gensch, C.-O.: Environmental and economic evaluation of the accelerated replacement of domestic appliances. ÖkoInstitut e.V., Freiburg 2007. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/environmental-and-economic-evaluation-of-the-accelerated-replacement-of-domestic-appliances/ on 31st of January 2018.
IPCC, 2007: Climate Change 2007: The Physical Science Basis. Contribution of Working Group I to the Fourth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change [Solomon, S., D. Qin, M. Manning, Z. Chen, M. Marquis, K.B. Averyt, M. Tignor and H.L. Miller (eds.)]. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, United Kingdom and New York, NY, USA, 996 pp.

exchanges.description:
Literature data. 

The power used by the reclamation machine as reported by the producer. 
0.7 kW reported by producer - Dayang (http://dyautoequip.en.alibaba.com/product/1639275705-219888480/r134a_refrigerant_recharging_equipment.html>, accessed 20150924 ).

Cross reference:
0.75 kW reported by another producer - Wonderfu (<http://www.wonderfu.com/sale-4009681-auto-r134a-recovery-machine-for-garage-refrigerant-reclaiming-equipment.html>, accessed 20150924).

The recovery speed during the reclamation as reported by the producer. 
250 g/min. reported by producer - Dayang (http://dyautoequip.en.alibaba.com/product/1639275705-219888480/r134a_refrigerant_recharging_equipment.html>, accessed 20150924 ).

Cross reference:
300 g/min. reported by another producer - Wonderfu (<http://www.wonderfu.com/sale-4009681-auto-r134a-recovery-machine-for-garage-refrigerant-reclaiming-equipment.html>, accessed 20150924).

exchanges.description:
The amount represents emissions from uncontrolled venting of the refrigerant that is contained in the refrigeration circuit of an average machine. According to literature, there are on average 290.5 g of refrigerant R12 in the refrigerator machine. The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (255 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units). It is assumed that the recovery efficiency is 70% according to IPCC.

Reference: Rüdenauer, I.; Gensch, C.-O.: Environmental and economic evaluation of the accelerated replacement of domestic appliances. ÖkoInstitut e.V., Freiburg 2007. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/environmental-and-economic-evaluation-of-the-accelerated-replacement-of-domestic-appliances/ on 31st of January 2018.
IPCC, 2007: Climate Change 2007: The Physical Science Basis. Contribution of Working Group I to the Fourth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change [Solomon, S., D. Qin, M. Manning, Z. Chen, M. Marquis, K.B. Averyt, M. Tignor and H.L. Miller (eds.)]. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, United Kingdom and New York, NY, USA, 996 pp.

flow.name: Dichlorodifluoromethane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
The amount represents emissions from uncontrolled venting of the refrigerant that is contained in the refrigeration circuit of an average machine. According to literature, there are 226 g of refrigerant R134a in the refrigerator machine. The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (2976 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units). Additionally, emissions from the blowing agent trapped in polyurethane foaming that functions as insulation for the refrigerator. Emissions correspond to an average machine. It is assumed that the recovery efficiency is 70% according to IPCC. According to literature, there are on average 392 g of refrigerant R134a trapped in the insulation foam (from the refrigerator machines that use R134a as refrigerant). The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (2976 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units). Therefore it is here assumed that an average value of 23% of the blowing agent present in the polyurethane foam is considered an emission to air.

Reference: Rüdenauer, I.; Gensch, C.-O.: Environmental and economic evaluation of the accelerated replacement of domestic appliances. ÖkoInstitut e.V., Freiburg 2007. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/environmental-and-economic-evaluation-of-the-accelerated-replacement-of-domestic-appliances/ on 31st of January 2018.
Prakash S, Manhart A, Amoyaw-Osei Y, Agyekum O (2010) Socio-economic Assessment and Feasibility Study on Sustainable E-waste Management in Ghana. Accra. Retrieved online at: http://www.sustainable-recycling.org/socio-economic-assessment-and-feasibility-study-on-sustainable-e-waste-management-in-ghana/ on 31st of January 2018.
IPCC, 2007: Climate Change 2007: The Physical Science Basis. Contribution of Working Group I to the Fourth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change [Solomon, S., D. Qin, M. Manning, Z. Chen, M. Marquis, K.B. Averyt, M. Tignor and H.L. Miller (eds.)]. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, United Kingdom and New York, NY, USA, 996 pp.

flow.name: 1,1,1,2-Tetrafluoroethane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
According literature data, even in the formal recycling facilities 16-30% of  the blowing agent traped in the polyurethane foam escapes to air as emission. Therefore it is here assumed that an average value of 23% of the blowing agent present in the polyurethane foam is considered an emission to air. There are on average 460 g of Cyclopentane trapped in the insulation foam (from the refrigerator machines that use R600a as refrigerant). The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (3288 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units). 

Reference: Prakash S, Manhart A, Amoyaw-Osei Y, Agyekum O (2010) Socio-economic Assessment and Feasibility Study on Sustainable E-waste Management in Ghana. Accra. Retrieved online at: http://www.sustainable-recycling.org/socio-economic-assessment-and-feasibility-study-on-sustainable-e-waste-management-in-ghana/ on 31st of January 2018.
Rüdenauer, I.; Gensch, C.-O.: Environmental and economic evaluation of the accelerated replacement of domestic appliances. ÖkoInstitut e.V., Freiburg 2007. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/environmental-and-economic-evaluation-of-the-accelerated-replacement-of-domestic-appliances/ on 31st of January 2018.
